docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 14--Rio de Janeiro music lovers overflowed the Opera House here last night and greeted with prolonged applause Arturo Toscanini's first appearance here after an absence of fifty-four years. The maestro visited Brazil during...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 14--Rio de Janeiro music lovers overflowed the Opera House here last night and greeted with prolonged applause Arturo Toscanini's first appearance here after an absence of fifty-four years. The maestro visited Brazil during Empire days, when Dom Pedro II was Emperor, or three years before Brazil became a republic.

headline.main: Toscanini Acclaimed in Rio de Janeiro; Plays There for First Time in 54 Years

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 15--It is becoming increasingly clear to observers of Pan-American relations that if the South American countries are to be saved from totalitarian economic domination the United States must find some way to buy from them on...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 15--It is becoming increasingly clear to observers of Pan-American relations that if the South American countries are to be saved from totalitarian economic domination the United States must find some way to buy from them on a basis sufficiently substantial to free them from the temptations of barter trade.

headline.main: TRADE, NOT LOANS, HELD KEY TO SOUTH AMERICA; Revision of U.S. Policy Toward Heavy Buying Deemed Vital if We Are to Block Totalitarian Powers There Nazi Victory Expected The Loan Method Income for Latin America Customs Union Idea

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO. Uruguay, June 15--This country's investigation of Nazi activities is declared here to have proved conclusively that democracy throughout South America is seriously threatened by two movements that have spread their operations over the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO. Uruguay, June 15--This country's investigation of Nazi activities is declared here to have proved conclusively that democracy throughout South America is seriously threatened by two movements that have spread their operations over the entire continent.
docs.abstract: investigation discloses 2 Nazi movements to wreck democracy in South Amer

headline.main: URUGUAY EXPOSES TWO NAZI THREATS; Movements Designed to Wreck Democracy in All of South America Are Described ONE DIRECTED FROM REICH German Missions Held Active in It--Other, More Feared, Is the Fifth Column

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: THE Australian Government Trade Commissioner in the  United States received word from Australia's postal authorities last week that 1-penny, 2p, 3p and 6p stamps will be issued on July 15 to commemorate participation by the Australian Imperial Force...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE Australian Government Trade Commissioner in the United States received word from Australia's postal authorities last week that 1-penny, 2p, 3p and 6p stamps will be issued on July 15 to commemorate participation by the Australian Imperial Force in the European war.
docs.abstract: Rumanian and Turkish Entente stamps described; illus

headline.main: NEW ISSUES FROM AFAR; Australia Honors Troops in European War --Augentine Postal Centenary Sheet

docs.snippet: Robert C. Lee, executive vice president of Moore-McCormack Lines, sailed late Friday night for a conference with the company's branch offices and agencies in East Coast ports of South America.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 16 --Many Argentine Nationalists and Fascist and Natl. leaders are expected to be involved in the investigation of the explosion of two bombs aboard the British steamer Gascony at Buenos Aires, Argentina, last week.
